page.title: Once Upon a Time
page.text: Little Red Riding Hood lived in a village near the forest.

page.title: Introduction
page.text: Once upon a time there was a girl called Little Red RidingHood. She lived with her mother in a village near a forest.

page.title: The Mission
page.text: One day, Little Red Riding Hood went to visit her sick grandmother. She took a basket of food with her.

page.title: The Forest Path
page.text: On her way, Little Red Riding Hood met a wolf. "Hello," said the wolf.  “Where are you going?" "I'm going to visit my grandmother who lives in the forest," explained Little Red Riding Hood.

page.title: Grandma’s House
page.text: The wolf ran to her grandmother's house. He went inside and locked her in the wardrobe! He put on her nightgown and got into her bed.

page.title: Arrived at Grandmother's house
page.text: A little later, Little Red Riding Hood came to the house.She knocked on the door, then went inside.

page.title: Disguise
page.text: Little Red Riding Hood went over to Grandmother's bed."Oh Granny, what big ears you have," she said."All the better to hear you with,"answered the wolf.

page.title: Red Riding Hood's first question
page.text:
"Oh Granny, what big eyes you have," said Little Red Riding Hood.
"All the better to see you with," replied the wolf.

page.title: Red Riding Hood's second question
page.text:
"Oh Granny, what big teeth you have," said Little Red Riding Hood.
"Al the better to eat you with," said the wolf.

page.title: Call for Help
page.text: "Help!" shouted Little Red Riding Hood as she realized that there was a wolf in her grandmother's bed.  She ran out of the house.

page.title: The Rescue
page.text: A woodcutter was nearby. He heard Little Red Riding Hood's scream and ran to the house.

page.title: Safe Again
page.text: The woodcutter hit the wolf over the head. The wolf ran away and Little Red Riding Hood never saw him again.

page.title: Lesson learned
page.text: Little Red Riding Hood learned to never talk to strangers.
